job_body_html:
Department: 200100 - Office of the Provost

Position Summary

The Assistant Director of Institutional Research is responsible for managing external data reporting and providing data assistance to institutional research, evaluation, and assessment projects used to support institutional decision making, policy formation, mission, and strategic planning. The position reports to the Assistant Vice President of Institutional Planning and Effectiveness and works within the Office of Institutional Effectiveness and Sponsored Projects (of the Provost's Office). This position also works closely with the Assistant Director of Retention and Assessment and with the University's Accreditation Liaison Officer to the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) while serving all institution units to manage federally mandated reporting.

Essential Duties
  • Maintain updates to institutional research and analytics that support for strategic planning, University decision-making, and policy analysis (e.g., key performance indicators, annual census).
  • Manage mandated external reporting and serve as the main contact for IPEDS, gainful employment regulations, and external surveys such as US News, Barron's, Peterson's, etc.
  • Submit data as part of annual and cyclical MSCHE reporting in partnership with the Accreditation Liaison Officer.
  • Manage internal and external requests for institutional data such as key performance indicators.
  • Utilize existing technology to provide accessible, timely, statistical analyses and projections, and actionable data for strategic projects (e.g., Argos or Tableau dashboards).
  • Work with Banner module leaders and Information Technology to enforce data governance standards that keeps institutional data clean.
  • Support academic departments to fulfill data needs and concerns for accreditation reports and surveys.
  • Support programs of professional development for student learning assessment, institutional data use, and other institutional effectiveness activities.
  • Assists in data collection, management, cleanup, and storage as necessary
  • Provides survey development and administration support (e.g., Qualtrics support).
  • Develops and maintains positive and professional customer service and/or relations within the office/department and with all constituencies to include students, faculty, staff, guests, and employees.
  • Demonstrates a positive and professional attitude and treats everyone with dignity and respect.
Secondary Responsibilities
  • Other duties as assigned.
# of Direct Reports: 0

Required Qualifications
  • Master's degree in information technology, computer science, analytics or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years relevant experience.
  • Expert-level experience with Banner (or Colleague) in conjunction with data reporting tools (e.g., Argos, Tableau, Cognos, PowerBI).
  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to write and interpret complex SQL queries.
  • Experience with math/statistical software packages (e.g., R, Python, WEKA, MATLAB, etc.).
  • A positive attitude and ability to plan and adapt to change.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the application of technology to deliver information according to end-user specifications.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively multitask a wide variety of unrelated projects while under firm deadlines.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and with college departments across the University and cross-functional teams.
  • Knowledge of and commitment to the mission of La Salle University.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's degree in information technology, computer science, analytics or related field.
  • Proven record of successful supervisory experience in a people-oriented environment.
Physical Requirements and/or Unusual Work Hours
  • None
Application Open Date: 11/05/2019

job_name: Associate Director - Data Collection and Assessment Support
job_body: Associate Director - Data Collection and Assessment SupportPosition Category: Staff - Full-TimeSummary:UVU Institutional Research (IR) is seeking a dynamic, driven leader to join the team. As part of the Institutional Research leadership team, manage the work of analysts in data collection and assessment efforts as well as conduct projects as a senior research analyst. Support the development of analysts' professional and technical skills. Develop positive working relationships with strategic decision-makers campus wide. Oversee the quality of relevant IR offerings and promote data literacy campus wide. Assist in the coordination of communication with clients and constituents. Perform both leadership and specialist roles to support the Director in all aspects of IR administration, including but not limited to: operations, project management, quality control, strategic planning, communication, and collaboration with stakeholders and clients (internal and external). Within IR, model, help develop, and implement guidelines for project management, client outreach, and customer service, as well as play a key role in monitoring the flow of projects using IR's project management system.Required Qualifications:Graduation from an accredited institution with a Masters degree in Business or Public Administration, Education, Social Science, or a related field plus three years of directly-related professional experience, OR Graduation from an accredited institution with a Bachelors degree in the above areas or a related field plus five years of directly-related professional experience.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Awareness of higher education environment and issues; working knowledge of data, qualitative and quantitative research methodology, and analysis.   Familiarity with relational databases and techniques to extract data.   Experience working with customers in a professional-service environment.   Experience managing people and projects, problem solving, and handling conflict.   Solid sense of data with an ability to simplify complex concepts for decision makers.   Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including effectively conveying complex information simply and presenting information to individuals and/or groups to inform, educate, and persuade.   Strong written, oral, and visual communication skills; excellent organizational and project management skills; skill in computers and computer applications including project management, team management, and communication tools.   Demonstrated ability to engage and lead a team of professionals by providing a vision and actionable strategies that allow individuals to optimally perform individual responsibilities, professionally develop, and achieve team goals.   Demonstrated ability to utilize statistics, analytical, and reporting tools such as SPSS, Excel, Tableau, Qualtrics, Power BI, or other related programs.   Demonstrated ability to advise and influence leaders and effectively contribute subject matter expertise that facilitates informed decision making.   Demonstrated ability to identify and accomplish goals and achieve timely and high-quality results.   Demonstrated ability to consult and advise clients in defining and developing projects; demonstrated ability to think critically and to manage and respond to complex issues and multiple priorities. Preferred Qualifications:Experience managing a team of professionalsPhysical Requirements:Physical ability to sit at a desk and type on a computer for long periods of time, ability to go to meetings and walk around campus, ability to talk and convey information verbally and in writing, and occasional travel.Benefits Summary:UVU offers an excellent benefits package which includes a generous leave policy, 12 paid holidays, affordable medical and dental insurance options, life and AD&D insurance, tuition waiver (undergraduate resident) for employee and dependents and substantial employer contribution to a retirement plan.FLSA: ExemptPay Range: $63,151 - $78,939Advertisement Number: STA213618 Institutional Research/IInfo Staff 01/05/2020Open Date: 12/10/2019Review Start Date: 12/16/2019Close Date: 1/5/2020Open Until Filled: NoSpecial Instructions to Applicant: Priority consideration will be given to those applicants who apply on or before the Review Start Date." job_body_html:
Associate Director - Data Collection and Assessment Support


Position Category: Staff - Full-Time

Summary:
UVU Institutional Research (IR) is seeking a dynamic, driven leader to join the team. As part of the Institutional Research leadership team, manage the work of analysts in data collection and assessment efforts as well as conduct projects as a senior research analyst. Support the development of analysts' professional and technical skills. Develop positive working relationships with strategic decision-makers campus wide. Oversee the quality of relevant IR offerings and promote data literacy campus wide. Assist in the coordination of communication with clients and constituents. Perform both leadership and specialist roles to support the Director in all aspects of IR administration, including but not limited to: operations, project management, quality control, strategic planning, communication, and collaboration with stakeholders and clients (internal and external). Within IR, model, help develop, and implement guidelines for project management, client outreach, and customer service, as well as play a key role in monitoring the flow of projects using IR's project management system.

Required Qualifications:
Graduation from an accredited institution with a Masters degree in Business or Public Administration, Education, Social Science, or a related field plus three years of directly-related professional experience,
OR
Graduation from an accredited institution with a Bachelors degree in the above areas or a related field plus five years of directly-related professional experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Awareness of higher education environment and issues; working knowledge of data, qualitative and quantitative research methodology, and analysis.
  • Familiarity with relational databases and techniques to extract data.
  • Experience working with customers in a professional-service environment.
  • Experience managing people and projects, problem solving, and handling conflict.
  • Solid sense of data with an ability to simplify complex concepts for decision makers.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including effectively conveying complex information simply and presenting information to individuals and/or groups to inform, educate, and persuade.
  • Strong written, oral, and visual communication skills; excellent organizational and project management skills; skill in computers and computer applications including project management, team management, and communication tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage and lead a team of professionals by providing a vision and actionable strategies that allow individuals to optimally perform individual responsibilities, professionally develop, and achieve team goals.
  • Demonstrated ability to utilize statistics, analytical, and reporting tools such as SPSS, Excel, Tableau, Qualtrics, Power BI, or other related programs.
  • Demonstrated ability to advise and influence leaders and effectively contribute subject matter expertise that facilitates informed decision making.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and accomplish goals and achieve timely and high-quality results.
  • Demonstrated ability to consult and advise clients in defining and developing projects; demonstrated ability to think critically and to manage and respond to complex issues and multiple priorities.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience managing a team of professionals

Physical Requirements:
Physical ability to sit at a desk and type on a computer for long periods of time, ability to go to meetings and walk around campus, ability to talk and convey information verbally and in writing, and occasional travel.

Benefits Summary:
UVU offers an excellent benefits package which includes a generous leave policy, 12 paid holidays, affordable medical and dental insurance options, life and AD&D insurance, tuition waiver (undergraduate resident) for employee and dependents and substantial employer contribution to a retirement plan.

FLSA: Exempt

Pay Range: $63,151 - $78,939

Advertisement Number: STA213618 Institutional Research/IInfo Staff 01/05/2020
Open Date: 12/10/2019
Review Start Date: 12/16/2019
Close Date: 1/5/2020
Open Until Filled: No

Special Instructions to Applicant: Priority consideration will be given to those applicants who apply on or before the Review Start Date." This job advertisement may close at any time after the review date.

To apply, visit: https://www.uvu.jobs/postings/16837

job_body_html:
Job Category
Staff & Executive - Human Resources

Overview

Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the state of New Jersey's preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. Established in 1766 and celebrated a milestone 250th anniversary in 2016, the university is the eighth oldest higher education institution in the United States. More than 70,800 students and 27,000 faculty and staff learn, work, and serve the public at Rutgers locations across New Jersey and around the world.

University Human Resources is dedicated to advancing Rutgers' standing as an employer of choice. We strive to recruit and develop and retain a diverse workforce committed to supporting the university's mission of providing for the instructional needs of New Jersey's citizens, conducting cutting edge research, and performing public service. To achieve this, we offer a competitive compensation package, while providing extensive programs and services for the more than 27,000 faculty and staff that are employed at Rutgers.

Posting Summary

Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Senior HR Data Analyst for University Human Resources (UHR). This position reports to the Associate Vice President for HR Operations. The Senior HR Data Analyst develops, proposes, and implements the framework and components for a data analytics and metrics program to actively support the strategic goals and objectives of UHR while providing university units with current metrics and dashboards to make data-informed decisions.

Among the key duties of this position are the following:

  • Leads the execution of any data analytics and visualization tasks during the full life cycle of each project, which may include data sourcing and blending, query design, analysis of query results, and development of visualizations for incorporation into client deliverables such as reports and management dashboards.
  • Identifies, acquires, and builds datasets needed to design and develop queries and workflows to be used for continuous monitoring. Reviews and analyzes query results to identify items of interest for review by university units.
  • Performs analytics for projects and initiatives as required for all UHR functional areas. Identifies, acquires, and builds datasets that enable the efficiency and effectiveness of data interpretation and application of data trends to monitor and improve processes and procedures, and continually enhance the customer experience.
  • Acts as a resource to collaborate with and assist units in optimizing the usage of implemented queries and workflows. Works on assigned projects, independently or in coordination with clients, based on the scope and nature of the data analytics component of the project.
  • Plays a critical role in strengthening HR's strategic business partnerships by collaborating with customers and serving as workforce analytics and strategy expert and providing university units with current metrics and dashboards to make data-informed decisions.
  • As the subject matter expert, collaborates with and mentors UHR staff to build and mature data analytics capabilities. Promotes and facilitates access and training to the university community in the use of reports and dashboards.
  • Performs other duties as required.
Position Status: Full Time

FLSA: Exempt

Grade: 07

Annual Minimum Salary: 77435.000

Annual Mid Range Salary: 98013.000

Annual Maximum Salary: 118590.000

Standard Hours: 37.50

Union Description: Administrators Confidential

Payroll Designation: PeopleSoft

Benefits

Information about the benefits provided to Rutgers employees can be found at: http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview

Terms of Appointment: Staff - 12 month

Position Pension Eligibility: ABP

Minimum Education and Experience
  • Bachelor's Degree is required in Business, Economics, Human Resources or Mathematics, or related field.
  • A minimum of five (5) years' experience is required with metrics, analytics, or other data-focused area.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • Proven skills analyzing and interpreting data.
  • Ability to effectively partner with others and remain customer service focused by meeting the needs of the business.
  • Strong attention to detail and easily adapts to new assignments, systems, and tools.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Advance knowledge of Excel including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and graphs.
  • Understanding of ERP Systems, particularly Oracle, and resulting data, including data warehouses with the ability to independently explore and build data sources as needed.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Advanced degree in a related field, and experience in a higher education setting.
  • Experience with Tableau, Microsoft VBA, SQL, Java/JavaScript, or other visualization tools and programming languages.
Posting Open Date: 12/12/2019

Regional Campus: Rutgers University-New Brunswick

Home Location Campus: Cook (RU-New Brunswick)

Location Details

New Brunswick, NJ, 08901

job_body:
Stanford University's Center on Food Security and the Environment (FSE) addresses critical global issues of hunger, poverty and
environmental degradation. Our long-term goals focus on designing new approaches to solving food security's global challenges by building an
evolving research portfolio with a team of experts in relevant scientific, economic, and policy areas. FSE is a joint effort of the Freeman
Spogli Institute for International Studies and the Stanford Woods Institute for the Environment.We seek a research data analyst
(RDA) to contribute to several research projects that combine new data sources and computational tools to study global poverty and food
security working with Professor Marshall Burke. The RDA will help with identifying, assembling, and geo-coding datasets on household assets,
food security, and health in the developing world, and will help with analyzing satellite imagery. S/he will also participate in lab
meetings of the Stanford SustainLab (sustain.stanford.edu). The goal of this work is to predict, using imagery and other non-traditional
data (e.g. social media data), various measures of economic well-being in the developing world. Some knowledge of remote sensing is desired.
The position will require a very organized and creative person who is capable of writing efficient code and working with large datasets.
Must have exceptional mathematical and statistical modeling and computer programming skills and willingness to use them in innovative
manner. Must have the ability to work comfortably and effectively within an interdisciplinary research environment. Past data analysts
working in this role have earned co-authorship on top scientific publications.This is a 100% FTE Fixed-Term position. The term
concludes on year from the start date, and may be extended based on program need and funding availability.For consideration,
please submit resume and cover letter. All final candidates must complete a background check.In this role, you
will: Collect, manage and clean datasets. Employ new and existing tools to interpret, analyze, and visualize
multivariate relationships in data. Create databases and reports, develop algorithms and statistical models, and perform
statistical analyses appropriate to data and reporting requirements. Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially
problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest
possible solutions. Develop reports, charts, graphs and tables for use by investigators and for publication and presentation.
Analyze data processes in documentation. Collaborate with faculty and research staff on data collection and analysis
methods. Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff. Communicate with
government officials, grant agencies and industry representatives.  * - Other duties may also be assignedTo be
successful in this role, you will bring: Bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience.
Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering. Substantial experience with MS
Office and analytical programs. Strong writing and analytical skills. Ability to prioritize workload. In addition, preferred requirements include: * Experience with Python, R and/or Stata is preferred.Why Stanford Is for You Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved
through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the
world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy. Our
culture and unique perks empower you with: Freedom to grow. We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, or audit a
course. Join a TedTalk, film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak. A caring culture. We provide superb
retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources. A healthier you. Climb our rock wall, or choose from hundreds of
health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We also provide excellent health care benefits. Discovery and
fun. Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums. Enviable resources. Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing
incentives, discounts and more.  Note: The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job
classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities.
Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the
job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.Consistent with its obligations under the
law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the
essential functions of the job.Stanford is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration
without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other
characteristic protected by law.Additional Information Schedule: Full-time
Job Code: 4751 Employee Status: Fixed-Term Grade: G
Requisition ID: 85680
job_body_html:
Stanford University's Center on Food Security and the Environment (FSE) addresses critical global issues of hunger, poverty and environmental degradation. Our long-term goals focus on designing new approaches to solving food security's global challenges by building an evolving research portfolio with a team of experts in relevant scientific, economic, and policy areas. FSE is a joint effort of the Freeman Spogli Institute for International Studies and the Stanford Woods Institute for the Environment.

We seek a research data analyst (RDA) to contribute to several research projects that combine new data sources and computational tools to study global poverty and food security working with Professor Marshall Burke. The RDA will help with identifying, assembling, and geo-coding datasets on household assets, food security, and health in the developing world, and will help with analyzing satellite imagery. S/he will also participate in lab meetings of the Stanford SustainLab (sustain.stanford.edu). The goal of this work is to predict, using imagery and other non-traditional data (e.g. social media data), various measures of economic well-being in the developing world. Some knowledge of remote sensing is desired. The position will require a very organized and creative person who is capable of writing efficient code and working with large datasets. Must have exceptional mathematical and statistical modeling and computer programming skills and willingness to use them in innovative manner. Must have the ability to work comfortably and effectively within an interdisciplinary research environment. Past data analysts working in this role have earned co-authorship on top scientific publications.

This is a 100% FTE Fixed-Term position. The term concludes on year from the start date, and may be extended based on program need and funding availability.

For consideration, please submit resume and cover letter. All final candidates must complete a background check.

In this role, you will:
  • Collect, manage and clean datasets.
  • Employ new and existing tools to interpret, analyze, and visualize multivariate relationships in data.
  • Create databases and reports, develop algorithms and statistical models, and perform statistical analyses appropriate to data and reporting requirements.
  • Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest possible solutions.
  • Develop reports, charts, graphs and tables for use by investigators and for publication and presentation.
  • Analyze data processes in documentation.
  • Collaborate with faculty and research staff on data collection and analysis methods.
  • Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.
  • Communicate with government officials, grant agencies and industry representatives.
* - Other duties may also be assigned

To be successful in this role, you will bring:
  • Bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.
  • Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.
  • Strong writing and analytical skills.
  • Ability to prioritize workload.
In addition, preferred requirements include:
* Experience with Python, R and/or Stata is preferred.

Why Stanford Is for You

Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy. Our culture and unique perks empower you with:
  • Freedom to grow. We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, or audit a course. Join a TedTalk, film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak.
  • A caring culture. We provide superb retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources.
  • A healthier you. Climb our rock wall, or choose from hundreds of health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We also provide excellent health care benefits.
  • Discovery and fun. Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums.
  • Enviable resources. Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing incentives, discounts and more.
Note: The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of the job.

Stanford is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Additional Information

The Kinder Institute seeks a candidate to fill a role as Data Analyst for the Urban Data Platform. The Urban Data Platform (UDP) brings together hundreds of different datasets about Houston and surrounding areas in a secure computing environment. Housed on Rice University's secure servers, the Urban Data Platform is a system designed for storing, processing and analyzing public, as well as confidential, data from government, nonprofits, and academia. The data analyst is primarily responsible for the organization of files, learning about and understanding datasets acquired, cleaning data, performing geocoding and spatial joins, designing analysis-ready datasets, and documenting all aspects of the data life cycle. In addition, the data analyst assists in intermediate administrative functions.This position reports to the data manager of the Urban Data Platform. The ideal candidate for this position is highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, s/he should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth. job_body_html:
Department: Kinder Institute for Urban Research

Full Time/Part Time: Full-Time

Requisition Number: S20300

Open Date: 12/13/2019

Salary Information

Salary Commensurate with Experience and Qualifications

Work Schedule

Standard 40-hour work week with some flexibility.

Benefits Eligible: Yes

Eligible for Overtime: No

Position Summary

The Kinder Institute for Urban Research is a multi-disciplinary "think-and-do tank" housed on the Rice University campus in central Houston, focusing on urban issues in Houston, the American Sun Belt, and around the world. The Kinder Institute seeks a candidate to fill a role as Data Analyst for the Urban Data Platform.

The Urban Data Platform (UDP) brings together hundreds of different datasets about Houston and surrounding areas in a secure computing environment. Housed on Rice University's secure servers, the Urban Data Platform is a system designed for storing, processing and analyzing public, as well as confidential, data from government, nonprofits, and academia.

As member of the Urban Data Platform team at the Kinder Institute, the data analyst performs a variety of technical duties involved in the acquisition, processing, and managing of large datasets for use in analysis in conjunction with academic and community-based research projects. The data analyst is primarily responsible for the organization of files, learning about and understanding datasets acquired, cleaning data, performing geocoding and spatial joins, designing analysis-ready datasets, and documenting all aspects of the data life cycle. In addition, the data analyst assists in intermediate administrative functions.

This position reports to the data manager of the Urban Data Platform.

The ideal candidate for this position is highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, s/he should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth. S/he has strong problem solving skills, a keen attention to detail, and is able to plan work and meet deadlines.

Education Required: Bachelor's Degree

Major/Discipline

Quantitative field.

Substitution for Education Requirement
May substitute additional related experience, above and beyond what is required, on an equivalent year for year basis in lieu of the education requirement.

Education Preferred:

Master's degree.

Experience Required: 3 years

Type of Experience:

Related experience in:

  • Data management, processing, and scrubbing
  • Developing metadata and technical documentation
  • Working with multiple data formats
  • Working with relational databases
  • Generating data summaries and reports
Substitution for Experience Requirement
Education may not be substituted for the experience requirement.

Experience Preferred

Related experience in:

  • Using GIS and working with spatial data
  • Working collaboratively with team members
  • Working with socioeconomic, environmental, or health data
  • Automating workflows
Skills Required
  • Knowledge of SAS and SQL
  • Excellent analytical and research skills
  • Ability to build reports
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills including proofreading
  • Excellent presentation skills
Skills Preferred
  • Knowledge of basic database design and ETL concepts
  • Knowledge of data summary and report building methods
  • Knowledge of data integrity validation methods
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Knowledge of data processing automation methods
  • Knowledge of programming in Python and R
  • Knowledge of geographic information system (GIS) software
Internal / External Contacts

Internal: Frequent contact with the data manager and team members.

External: Frequent contact with clients for whom the data are being prepared and occasional contact with data suppliers.

Physical Demands

Requires working at a computer for extended periods of time (up to eight hours per day).

Working Conditions
  • Monday through Friday standard, 40 hour work week with some flexibility
  • General office work environment
  • May require extended hours to meet deadlines
Essential Personnel

Position is not considered essential during a campus emergency.

Rice University Standard of Civility

Serves as a representative of the University, displaying courtesy, tact, consideration and discretion in all interactions with other members of the Rice community and with the public.

Security Sensitive:

As defined under the Texas Education Code and Rice Policy No. 425, this position is security sensitive and employment in this position is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

Essential Functions
  • Participates in the design, planning and implementation of research projects and data analysis
  • Identifies, locates and obtains data/information
  • Utilizes statistical software to quantify data
  • Designs database models
  • Builds automated reporting solutions
  • Manipulates and cleans-up data
  • Completes data analysis
  • Reports research findings
  • Ensures information presented is valid and accurate
  • Develops presentations and reports
  • Performs all other duties as assigned
Additional Functions or Information
  • Acquires data
  • Writes code to perform ETL, cleanup, standardization, validation tests, data summaries, and reports
  • Prepares metadata and technical documentation
  • Audits code and reviews documentation prepared by others
  • Assists the data manager and information technology staff with data security issues as needed

job_body:
Tracking Code 8873 Job Description Position Description Details The Program Data
Analyst provides analytical and organizational support for Global Programs, in support of Boston Universitys global strategy. Among the
responsibilities are: (i) Perform complex data analysis using and developing advanced Excel worksheets, extracting data and creating reports
and presentations from the Universitys Academic Data Warehouse (ADW) and local databases, which includes FileMaker; (ii) Engage in
high-level statistical research and longitudinal studies to analyze the success of the global initiatives and the Universitys global
strategy, and proactively engage in recommendations when possible; (iii) Track and report on new trends and developments as well as best
practices in global education among large research institutions; (iv) Develop systems for efficiently obtaining relevant data; and (v)
Support global initiatives of the University and within Global Programs (i.e. seed fund, competitive analysis) The Program Data Analyst
reports to the Special Advisor for the Vice President and Associate Provost and Chief of Staff, and works in a collaborative team
environment with all members of the Global Support team, specifically the Strategy and Communications group. Position
Essential Functions: Identify the appropriate data sources and how to extract, transform, clean, and manipulate the
data to uncover trends. Focus on data architecture, information flow, and management of multiple data sources. Design reports to reflect and
analyze the universitys global engagement and report to external surveys. Create and manage regular and ad hoc reports utilizing available
Global Programs and University data. (25%) Meet with business stakeholders from all Global Programs units (Study Abroad, CELOP,
ISSO, Global Support) to understand the business questions and then develop and deliver accurate, consistent, and timely reports in
user-friendly outputs such as Excel or Power BI. Participate in university-wide meetings and committees (e.g. Data Governance Working Group)
representing Global Programs and collaborate with other units across BU. (25%) Manage an internal database to store data from
multiple sources. Develop and suggest data governance best practices to key business members to promote data consistency across all units
and all data sources. Aim to reduce data redundancies and clarify data definitions. (25%) Create research reports for senior staff
before travel, delegation visits, or other university business. Design procedures to ensure accurate and uniform statistical reporting to
both internal and external audiences. (15%) Design and create data visualizations and present report findings to a non-technical
audience. (10%) Required Skills B.A./B.S. in related field. Self-starter, highly motivated with minimal
direction. 3-5 years of professional experience in fast paced operational environment. Excellent analytical, decision
making, and problem solving skills. Extract, transform, load (ETL), troubleshooting, and reporting experience at an advanced level,
preferably in the field of education. Excellent project management skills with proven ability to successfully manage multiple
projects simultaneously and to meet tight deadlines. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to summarize and
present findings to non-technical audiences. Thinks qualitatively as well as quantitatively. Ability to produce
high-quality work reflecting attention to detail and accuracy. Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, SQL, and Power BI (or other data visualization tool). Proficiency with R or Python. Higher
education experience preferred. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration
for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status,
protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Position
Type Full-Time/Regular

Job Description

Position Description Details The Program Data Analyst provides analytical and organizational support for Global Programs, in support of Boston Universitys global strategy. Among the responsibilities are: (i) Perform complex data analysis using and developing advanced Excel worksheets, extracting data and creating reports and presentations from the Universitys Academic Data Warehouse (ADW) and local databases, which includes FileMaker; (ii) Engage in high-level statistical research and longitudinal studies to analyze the success of the global initiatives and the Universitys global strategy, and proactively engage in recommendations when possible; (iii) Track and report on new trends and developments as well as best practices in global education among large research institutions; (iv) Develop systems for efficiently obtaining relevant data; and (v) Support global initiatives of the University and within Global Programs (i.e. seed fund, competitive analysis) The Program Data Analyst reports to the Special Advisor for the Vice President and Associate Provost and Chief of Staff, and works in a collaborative team environment with all members of the Global Support team, specifically the Strategy and Communications group.

Position Essential Functions:

  • Identify the appropriate data sources and how to extract, transform, clean, and manipulate the data to uncover trends. Focus on data architecture, information flow, and management of multiple data sources. Design reports to reflect and analyze the universitys global engagement and report to external surveys. Create and manage regular and ad hoc reports utilizing available Global Programs and University data. (25%)
  • Meet with business stakeholders from all Global Programs units (Study Abroad, CELOP, ISSO, Global Support) to understand the business questions and then develop and deliver accurate, consistent, and timely reports in user-friendly outputs such as Excel or Power BI. Participate in university-wide meetings and committees (e.g. Data Governance Working Group) representing Global Programs and collaborate with other units across BU. (25%)
  • Manage an internal database to store data from multiple sources. Develop and suggest data governance best practices to key business members to promote data consistency across all units and all data sources. Aim to reduce data redundancies and clarify data definitions. (25%)
  • Create research reports for senior staff before travel, delegation visits, or other university business. Design procedures to ensure accurate and uniform statistical reporting to both internal and external audiences. (15%)
  • Design and create data visualizations and present report findings to a non-technical audience. (10%)
Required Skills
  • B.A./B.S. in related field. Self-starter, highly motivated with minimal direction.
  • 3-5 years of professional experience in fast paced operational environment.
  • Excellent analytical, decision making, and problem solving skills.
  • Extract, transform, load (ETL), troubleshooting, and reporting experience at an advanced level, preferably in the field of education.
  • Excellent project management skills with proven ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously and to meet tight deadlines.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to summarize and present findings to non-technical audiences.
  • Thinks qualitatively as well as quantitatively.
  • Ability to produce high-quality work reflecting attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel, SQL, and Power BI (or other data visualization tool). Proficiency with R or Python.
  • Higher education experience preferred.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment with intensive public contact environment. Demonstrated ability to coordinate and perform multiple projects. Demonstrated ability to maintain effective customer service in a high volume, intense processing environment. Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver effective training. Special licenses, registration or certification None Education or training None Level and type of experience Considerable experience working in Higher Education, similar industry or field. Considerable experience working with Department of Education software, third party software and a University system preferably Banner. Some experience supervising and training. Preferred knowledge, skills, abilities, education, experience, licensure, certification Strong technical (programming) and analytic skills (preferably: Banner, Insight, Java and MS Office suite). Working knowledgeable of SQL and basic coding. Some experience working with databases. Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Some experience working in Higher Education environment. Strong customer service skills. Responsible for banner yearly implementation, testing, set-up, training and reporting. Given the nature of the positions in Student Engagement & Enrollment Services that provide support to student services and/or student-centered programs, the employee occupying this position may be required to work during a university closing. There may be occasions where the employee will be asked to work during university closings as directed by his or her supervisor. job_body_html:
The Assistant Director of Institutional Research in the Office of Institutional Effectiveness will conduct institutional research with appropriate analysis and reporting. This is a data-heavy position with key responsibilities to include: data collection and management, data quality control, database cleaning, data analysis, and report writing.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Manage, coordinate and perform institutional research/data collection as required for accrediting bodies, state and federal agencies, and information needs of the institution.
  • Manage quantitative and qualitative research projects, including surveying, data collection, data organization, documentation, and analysis in support of planning, evidence-based decision-making, and student success.
  • Analyze, interpret and present information and research findings on student, faculty and other variables for institutional strategic planning, problem solving, and decision-making.
  • Apply research findings to academic program and institutional planning and to assist in the development of long term strategies necessary to insure the long term health of the institution.
  • Manage external reporting cycles and reports (such as national statistical surveys and questionnaires).
  • Prepare, publish, and present data and statistics in a manner understandable to various audiences.
  • Regularly update various internal data publications (Student Enrollment Profile, Annual Fact book, Environmental Scan, etc).
  • Design and maintain IR project/request queue; document and archive results.
Qualifications:
  • Master's degree required in Education, Higher Education Administration, Research or related field.
  • Three years of experience in multiple areas of higher education to include institutional research, institutional effectiveness, data analysis, and research methodology.
  • Experience in the use of higher education student information systems.
  • Proficiency using databases, spreadsheets, and statistical analysis software (i.e. SPSS, SAS) for research purposes.
  • Strong analytical skills and detail orientation.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to a variety of audiences and translate data into useful information for decision-makers and the AMDA community.
  • Time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies.

job_body: Job ID: 290966 Department GENERAL SURGERY (IN-SGEN-IUINA) Department Information As part of the largest medical school in the United States, the Department of Surgery at IU School of Medicine consists of six divisions, including general surgery, pediatric surgery, plastic surgery, transplantation surgery, cardiothoracic surgery and peripheral vascular surgery. More than 120 faculty members help mentor 100 residents and fellows each academic year pursuing specialized training. Job Summary We are looking for two new analysts to join our team who will manage and analyze data for health services research projects in surgery. The ideal candidate will be able to determine the correct statistical methods to use based on research question and study design. This role may also be required to assist clinical faculty in designing studies and needs to be comfortable making decisions about coding and classifying medical data. Salary will be up to $63K. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in biostatistics, epidemiology, or a related field and two years of experience analyzing data using SAS, STATA and/or other programming languages.  Combinations of education and related experience may be considered. Strong analytical and writing skills. Knowledge and ability to perform statistical analysis. Knowledge of SAS or STATA programming, REDCap, Microsoft Office, and medical terminology. Experience in analysis of healthcare data and understanding of medical terminology and EHR systems. Ability to effectively communicate and exchange information. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree and experience working with INPC or national data. Proficiency in advanced statistical methods such as longitudinal data analysis and propensity score matching. Familiarity working with qualitative data. Working Conditions / Demands Ability to travel between office/campus and hospital(s) various times throughout the day. Utilize standard office equipment (computer, phone, copier, fax, etc.). Must be able to perform essential job functions with or without an accommodation. Work Location Indianapolis, Indiana This position requires travel between office/campus and hospital(s) various times throughout the day. job_body_html:
Job ID: 290966

Department

GENERAL SURGERY (IN-SGEN-IUINA)

Department Information

As part of the largest medical school in the United States, the Department of Surgery at IU School of Medicine consists of six divisions, including general surgery, pediatric surgery, plastic surgery, transplantation surgery, cardiothoracic surgery and peripheral vascular surgery. More than 120 faculty members help mentor 100 residents and fellows each academic year pursuing specialized training.

Job Summary

We are looking for two new analysts to join our team who will manage and analyze data for health services research projects in surgery. The ideal candidate will be able to determine the correct statistical methods to use based on research question and study design. This role may also be required to assist clinical faculty in designing studies and needs to be comfortable making decisions about coding and classifying medical data. Salary will be up to $63K.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in biostatistics, epidemiology, or a related field and two years of experience analyzing data using SAS, STATA and/or other programming languages.

Combinations of education and related experience may be considered.

  • Strong analytical and writing skills.
  • Knowledge and ability to perform statistical analysis.
  • Knowledge of SAS or STATA programming, REDCap, Microsoft Office, and medical terminology.
  • Experience in analysis of healthcare data and understanding of medical terminology and EHR systems.
  • Ability to effectively communicate and exchange information.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's degree and experience working with INPC or national data.
  • Proficiency in advanced statistical methods such as longitudinal data analysis and propensity score matching.
  • Familiarity working with qualitative data.
Working Conditions / Demands

Ability to travel between office/campus and hospital(s) various times throughout the day. Utilize standard office equipment (computer, phone, copier, fax, etc.). Must be able to perform essential job functions with or without an accommodation.

Work Location

Indianapolis, Indiana

This position requires travel between office/campus and hospital(s) various times throughout the day.

Job Classification

Salary Plan: PAE

Salary Grade: 3IT

FLSA: Exempt

Job Function: Information Technology

Equal Employment Opportunity

Indiana University is an equal employment and affirmative action employer and a provider of ADA services. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ethnicity, color, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, disability status or protected veteran status. Indiana University does not discriminate on the basis of sex in its educational programs and activities, including employment and admission, as required by Title IX. Questions or complaints regarding Title IX may be referred to the U.S. Department of Education Office for Civil Rights or the university Title IX Coordinator. See Indiana University's Notice of Non-Discrimination here which includes contact information.

job_body_html:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Senior Research Analyst provides statistical and analytical support for the efforts of the University’s Office of Institutional Research and Planning.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Leads the effort in preparing and delivering the University’s enrollment reporting. Assists in planning and coordinating information reporting and information processing activities.
  • Assists in the development and utilization of enrollment forecasting, budget planning, revenue calculations and other operational models of higher education activity.
  • Provides programmatic and/or statistical modeling solutions to complex institutional challenges. Delivers the solutions as requested and defined.
  • Designs, maintains and utilizes MS Access databases specifically for the department’s current and historical reporting requirements.
  • Designs, maintains and utilizes MS Excel tools developed with and without Macros and Visual Basic programming.
  • Monitors, identifies and reports trends related to institutional indices and benchmarks.
  • Collects and analyzes data used in support of institutional planning and budgeting activities.
  • Performs extensive querying of data and authoring of reports using the University’s Cognos business intelligence software.
  • Queries and manipulates data from the University’s Ellucian Banner student information system and from other databases maintained in Microsoft Access.
  • Evaluates existing institutional processes and makes recommendations and/or provides system-based solutions to either streamline, replace, or repair this processes.
  • Prepares written reports and studies pertaining to enrollment and other higher education operating parameters for delivery to upper management of the University.
  • Collaborates with other offices within the University on cross-divisional research projects, where appropriate.
  • Assists in the collection of institutional data for use in survey responses supplied for media, publishers, government agencies and other external entities.
  • Completes special projects and other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in business, mathematics, computer science, educational research, social science, information science, public management, or related field from an accredited institution.

Preferred qualifications:
  • Minimum of three years of progressively responsible experience in a business or higher education setting is preferred.
  • Prior experience working in a budget and planning area is preferred.
  • Preferred computer skills: Advanced VBA programming in Excel to maintain existing tools (interview may include a skills test to verify proficiency). Advanced Access database skills, Access VBA and Form creation a plus. Moderate SQL querying. Basic VB.Net utilizing Visual Studio to maintain web applications useful. Experience with Ellucian Banner and IBM Cognos is also highly preferred.
  • Alternately, the successful candidate will possess any equivalent combination or training and experience which provides the knowledge, skills and abilities required to perform the essential job functions. This includes, but is not limited to the following:
  • Qualitative and quantitative problem-solving skills in accounting, finance, marketing, quantitative analysis, research, and information systems;
  • Capacity to identify, research, and analyze strategic issues and to propose realistic solutions;
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively;
  • Required strong computer skills, including knowledge of the entire MS Office Suite.
  • High proficiency in the use of MS Excel and MS Access for the development of spreadsheets and databases;
  • Effective organizational and administrative skills;
Ability to initiate and follow through with work responsibilities and to meet deadlines:

Sensitivity to the need of each individual to be treated with dignity and respect as it relates to diversity in general and the mission of the university specifically; and

Ability and willingness to contribute actively to the mission and to respect the Spiritan Catholic identity of Duquesne University. The mission is implemented through a commitment to academic excellence, a spirit of service, moral and spiritual values, sensitivity to world concerns, and an ecumenical campus community.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:

Interested candidates should submit a cover letter, resume, and contact information for three professional references.

Catholic in its mission and ecumenical in spirit, Duquesne University values equality of opportunity as an educational institution and as an employer. We aspire to attract and sustain a diverse faculty and staff that reflects contemporary society, serves our academic goals and enriches our campus community. We particularly encourage applications from members of underrepresented groups and support dual-career couples through our charter membership in this region's HERC (http://www.hercjobs.org/oh-western-pa-wv/).

We invite applicants for this position to learn more about our university and its Spiritan heritage by visiting http://www.duq.edu/about/mission-and-identity/mission-statement. Those invited to campus for an interview may be asked about ways in which they see their talents contributing to the continued growth of our community and furthering its mission.

job_body: The Facilities and Campus Services (FCS) Business Analyst uses a data-driven approach to provide facilities related analytical information to FCS staff as well as campus partners. This position will guide the continuous improvement of FCS operations through business and data analysis, modeling, metrics, interpretation and recommendations. Responsibilities include collecting, analyzing and monitoring FCS data to inform decision-making, planning, policy formation and evaluation of departments' effectiveness. The analyst will develop and maintain a cycle of routine data-based reports for FCS leadership, collaborating with other offices across the University where necessary. This position will systematize and maintain a large and diverse archive of data files, and assist colleagues in varying projects to develop and maintain facilities-related metrics and provide analysis of data results using various reporting tools and data sources. Design, develop and interpret benchmark and metric reports used to measure financial and operating performance in support of Colleges and Units. Understand and articulate root causes of changes in FCS metrics. Collaborate with FCS leadership to gain broad knowledge of all FCS functional areas and systems and understand business objectives in order to identify and implement business analytics that will inform and/or influence business decisions. Participate in the definition of an organized approach to performing business analysis tasks, including the development of defined methodologies, documentation standards, and process mapping. This includes developing analytical models and providing narrative reports to support, inform, and where appropriate include decision-making as well as formulating hypotheses and alternative explanations using diverse data sources to enable FCS business operations to meet and exceed expectations. Assist in developing training programs in the principals of data-based decision making and data visualization for department management teams. Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, or related field with at least 3 years of experience working with large and complex data sets, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Ability to adapt to new computing systems. Experience working across computing platforms. Must appropriately handle confidential data. Requires accuracy and attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong presentation skills. Must be service oriented, demonstrate initiative and organizational commitment. Proven ability to work effectively both independently and with a team involved in projects where common goals are a must. job_body_html:
The Facilities and Campus Services (FCS) Business Analyst uses a data-driven approach to provide facilities related analytical information to FCS staff as well as campus partners. This position will guide the continuous improvement of FCS operations through business and data analysis, modeling, metrics, interpretation and recommendations.

Responsibilities include collecting, analyzing and monitoring FCS data to inform decision-making, planning, policy formation and evaluation of departments' effectiveness. The analyst will develop and maintain a cycle of routine data-based reports for FCS leadership, collaborating with other offices across the University where necessary. This position will systematize and maintain a large and diverse archive of data files, and assist colleagues in varying projects to develop and maintain facilities-related metrics and provide analysis of data results using various reporting tools and data sources. Design, develop and interpret benchmark and metric reports used to measure financial and operating performance in support of Colleges and Units. Understand and articulate root causes of changes in FCS metrics.

Collaborate with FCS leadership to gain broad knowledge of all FCS functional areas and systems and understand business objectives in order to identify and implement business analytics that will inform and/or influence business decisions. Participate in the definition of an organized approach to performing business analysis tasks, including the development of defined methodologies, documentation standards, and process mapping. This includes developing analytical models and providing narrative reports to support, inform, and where appropriate include decision-making as well as formulating hypotheses and alternative explanations using diverse data sources to enable FCS business operations to meet and exceed expectations. Assist in developing training programs in the principals of data-based decision making and data visualization for department management teams.

Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, or related field with at least 3 years of experience working with large and complex data sets, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Ability to adapt to new computing systems. Experience working across computing platforms. Must appropriately handle confidential data. Requires accuracy and attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong presentation skills. Must be service oriented, demonstrate initiative and organizational commitment. Proven ability to work effectively both independently and with a team involved in projects where common goals are a must.

job_body_html:
TITLE: Director of Institutional Research
DEPARTMENT: Institutional Effectiveness and System Integration
REPORTS TO: Assistant Vice President for Institutional Effectiveness and System Integration
DIRECT REPORTS: Student Employees
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time/Salary

JOB DESCRIPTION: The Director of Institutional Research works in conjunction with the Assistant Vice President of Institutional Effectiveness and Systems Integration (AVP IESI) to determine annual research priorities and ensure that these projects are managed to completion. The Director manages the scope of Institutional Research work and determines project prioritization, including negotiating, defining, and clarifying requests. The Director serves as support to the overall mission of institutional effectiveness and assessment efforts. These efforts include, but are not limited to, yearly assessment efforts, strategic planning, grant support, and periodic accreditation requirements, along with other data and reporting needs attributed to the support and improvement of the College as a whole. This position is a member of the AVP IESI's leadership team.

The Director conducts research and analysis for Daemen College, including coordinating and managing submissions of data to external agencies. The Director will provide analysis of the results of surveys to the College. Overall they will provide official, accurate, and unbiased information and analysis about the College to inform planning, support decision-making, and meet reporting obligations.

TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: Full-time exempt, thirty-five hours per week, twelve-month position, may require some evening and weekend hours during peak season.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Master's degree in relevant business or higher education-related field
  • Three or more years of experience applying skills in the field related to education or institutional planning; A combination of education, training, and experience leading experience in skills required
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, team based, deadline oriented environment; the ability to effectively manage complex tasks and prioritize multiple projects and competing priorities
  • Competency in managing and conducting organizational research in an academic enterprise or other public or private organization
  • Well-developed research skills, statistical skills, and analytical abilities; Advanced skill using SPSS for data analysis and experience using various relational databases (e.g., Oracle, Access) desired
  • Ability to interact and deal effectively with diverse groups of people and work with a wide variety of leadership styles at all levels of the organization. Experience working with senior executives is essential
  • Strong understanding of higher education policies and practices
  • Strong organizational and project management skills; strong problem-solving skills; high quality standards and attention to detail
Outstanding written and interpersonal communication skills:
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing and demonstrated ability to produce significant reports/documents
  • Superb presentation and facilitation skills
  • Strong diplomacy skills; Ability to handle the conflicting needs of multiple constituents.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Knowledge, experience with student information systems (SIS). Ellucian Colleague preferred or others such as Ellucian Banner, Oracle/PeopleSoft
  • Knowledge, experience with Entrinsik Informer preferred or other BI or Data Analysis software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Manage and organize a process for data/information project completion and delivery, including new, recurring and ad hoc projects and requests
  • Lead qualitative and quantitative research efforts as needed for academic and administrative departments, producing actionable written reports
  • Develop and deliver presentations of data at all campus levels, particularly written, executive-level summaries of survey and data warehouse-sourced information
  • Oversee the collection of academic and administrative trend information and analyzing, evaluating, and presenting the results (e.g. Fact Book, Common Data Set)
  • Use a variety of software to edit, organize data, and present reports
  • Manage the administration of student surveys, their analyses, and the presentation/publication of results
  • Ensures that all data reports from IR are of highest quality and useful for decision-making by university leadership
  • Support institutional accreditation efforts both at the academic program and institutional levels by supporting data and information needs for mandatory reports
  • Work closely with other offices to gather and/or present information about Daemen College to external audiences (e.g. Peterson's, Princeton Review, Open Doors, NCAA and various local media outlets)
  • Collaborate with Information Management on the collection, analysis, and warehousing of institutional data
  • Provide guidelines and support for college offices internal survey and assessment needs
  • Share good practice, data, and tools with a wide variety of decision-makers
  • Promote data literacy among faculty, staff, and administrators
  • Member of institution wide committees particularly in areas of data and information, retention, strategic planning, and others as assigned
  • Other projects and tasks as assigned
This is a full-time, exempt position. Benefits are available the first of the month following the full-time employee's date of hire and include health, dental, vision insurance, and fully paid life insurance. In addition, we offer fully paid long term disability insurance after 3 months of employment. Eligibility for the 403b retirement plan is available to full-time employees upon hire and an 8%employer match after one year of service. Excellent time off benefits for holidays, vacation and personal time is included. Tuition waiver benefits are also available for full-time employees and their qualified dependents.

Daemen College is an AA/EOE and strongly encourages applications from women, veterans, people of color, individuals with disabilities and candidates who will contribute to and support the cultural fluency and diversity of our campus. Apply directly at https://daemen.applicantpro.com/jobs/

job_body: Location: Washington, DC, US, 20016Company: American UniversitySummary/Objective This position is responsible for generating admissions data reports, conducting admissions and marketing data analyses, and developing and maintaining department-wide databases. This position reports directly to the Associate Director/Business Analyst. This person will assist the Associate Director on all matters related to the Office of Enrollment's data systems, including Colleague, Recruit (Microsoft Dynamics CRM), MicroStrategy Business Intelligence and Datatel Recruiter. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work Non-Exempt 35 Hours/Week Coordinator/Analyst B Essential Functions Queries data and prepares reports to respond to internal and external requests for admissions data. Manages daily, weekly, quarterly, annual and other reports used in enrollment management. Prepares quantitative and qualitative datasets related to the recruitment, admission, and conversion of freshmen and transfer applicants. Assist in the validation and maintenance of predictive modeling databases. Conducts regular data and file audits and ensuring rigorous quality control over data, analyses and metrics. Researches and incorporates external data sources (i.e, market research, demographic data) into existing datasets. Develops and maintains expertise in and facilitates staff utilization of the Office of Enrollment's data systems, including Colleague, MicroStrategy Business Intelligence and Datatel Recruiter. Salary Range $ 47,000.00-$50,000.00 - Annually Required Education and Experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent Program of study in social science, analytics or closely related field 1-3 years of relevant experience Business Intelligence (BI) skills: the combination of data mining, research and analytical methods which supports the collection, integration, analysis, and presentation of business information to enable informed data-driven decision making. Skill applying analytical methods, processes and techniques to conduct research and collect data; performing analysis, identifying trends, outliers and anomalies; evaluating findings, identifying advantages and disadvantages; extracting meaning and generating insights; drawing conclusions and developing recommendations and alternatives to solve business problems. Skill using statistical software packages (e.g., R, SPSS, SAS, Minitab) to manipulate data and conduct advanced data analysis applying ANOVA, correlation, regression, cluster and/or factor analysis techniques. Skill using relational databases and familiarity with transactional program languages, extract programs, and/or datamarts to query, mine, correlate, and analyze large-scale data sets. Strong numerical, verbal and written communications skills. Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks with competing deadlines.  Preferred Education and Experience 1-3 years of relevant experience Marketing and/or admissions knowledge and experience is preferred. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques is preferred. Additional Eligibility Qualifications Hiring offers for this position are contingent on successful completion of a background check Current American University Employees: If you are a current full-time or part-time staff member at American University, please log into AsuccessfulU through the myAU portal. Once in AsuccessfulU, please select the Careers tile which will take you to our internal career page.  Contact Us: For more information or assistance with the American University careers site, email theworkline@american.edu. job_body_html:
Location:
Washington, DC, US, 20016

Company:
American University

Summary/Objective

This position is responsible for generating admissions data reports, conducting admissions and marketing data analyses, and developing and maintaining department-wide databases.

This position reports directly to the Associate Director/Business Analyst. This person will assist the Associate Director on all matters related to the Office of Enrollment's data systems, including Colleague, Recruit (Microsoft Dynamics CRM), MicroStrategy Business Intelligence and Datatel Recruiter.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
  • Non-Exempt
  • 35 Hours/Week
  • Coordinator/Analyst B
Essential Functions
  1. Queries data and prepares reports to respond to internal and external requests for admissions data.
  2. Manages daily, weekly, quarterly, annual and other reports used in enrollment management.
  3. Prepares quantitative and qualitative datasets related to the recruitment, admission, and conversion of freshmen and transfer applicants.
  4. Assist in the validation and maintenance of predictive modeling databases.
  5. Conducts regular data and file audits and ensuring rigorous quality control over data, analyses and metrics.
  6. Researches and incorporates external data sources (i.e, market research, demographic data) into existing datasets.
  7. Develops and maintains expertise in and facilitates staff utilization of the Office of Enrollment's data systems, including Colleague, MicroStrategy Business Intelligence and Datatel Recruiter.
Salary Range
  • $ 47,000.00-$50,000.00 - Annually
Required Education and Experience
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • Program of study in social science, analytics or closely related field
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience
  • Business Intelligence (BI) skills: the combination of data mining, research and analytical methods which supports the collection, integration, analysis, and presentation of business information to enable informed data-driven decision making.
  • Skill applying analytical methods, processes and techniques to conduct research and collect data; performing analysis, identifying trends, outliers and anomalies; evaluating findings, identifying advantages and disadvantages; extracting meaning and generating insights; drawing conclusions and developing recommendations and alternatives to solve business problems.
  • Skill using statistical software packages (e.g., R, SPSS, SAS, Minitab) to manipulate data and conduct advanced data analysis applying ANOVA, correlation, regression, cluster and/or factor analysis techniques.
  • Skill using relational databases and familiarity with transactional program languages, extract programs, and/or datamarts to query, mine, correlate, and analyze large-scale data sets.
  • Strong numerical, verbal and written communications skills.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks with competing deadlines.
Preferred Education and Experience
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience
  • Marketing and/or admissions knowledge and experience is preferred.
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques is preferred.
Additional Eligibility Qualifications
  • Hiring offers for this position are contingent on successful completion of a background check

Current American University Employees:

If you are a current full-time or part-time staff member at American University, please log into AsuccessfulU through the myAU portal. Once in AsuccessfulU, please select the Careers tile which will take you to our internal career page. 

Contact Us:

For more information or assistance with the American University careers site, email theworkline@american.edu.

American University is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution that operates in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The university does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, personal appearance, gender identity and expression, family responsibilities, political affiliation, source of income, veteran status, an individual's genetic information or any other bases under federal or local laws (collectively "Protected Bases") in its programs and activities.
