job_body_html:
Riverland Community College welcomes applications from individuals who are passionate about helping students succeed. We are committed to supporting diversity in all of its forms. Applicants representing diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Working Title: Research Analysis Specialist
Appointment Information:
  • 214-MN Assoc of Prof Employees (MAPE)
  • Classified, Exempt
  • Unlimited full time
Location: Austin
Pay Range: $47,856- $70,198
Deadline to apply: 1/21/20

Position Purpose: Under administrative direction, this position provides comprehensive institutional research services for Riverland Community College in order to enhance data-driven decision making and college effectiveness in meeting key performance indicators. This position applies quantitative & qualitative research and statistical analysis methods including predictive analytics and forecasting to evaluate, interpret results and make recommendations to improve student success.

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field.
  • Three years of experience in a position with duties that include data management, data analysis, reporting, project management, and/or quantitative research.
  • Advanced proficiency with query and reporting tools (such as Excel and Access).
  • Experience with statistical computing tools (such as SPSS).
  • Strong ability to organize, take initiative and operate independently with minimal direction.
  • Ability to manage and complete multiple projects with strict deadlines.
  • Effective communication and presentation skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Master’s degree or higher.
  • Demonstrated experience with quantitative and qualitative research methods, statistical modeling and trend analysis.
  • Experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI and/or SAS.
  • Understanding of assessment practices in higher education including student learning assessment and academic program review.
  • Experience working with grants and data reporting.
  • Effective presentation and group facilitation skills.
Why work for Riverland Community College?
Employees of the Minnesota State system receive a competitive pay package that includes excellent health and financial benefits, ongoing professional development, opportunities for long-term career growth and advancement, time-off benefits, tuition waivers, wellness programs and pride in knowing that your work inspires personal success through education.

Application Procedure:
Applicants must apply online at https://www.mn.gov/mmb/careers. Search for Job ID 37933

A complete online application will include the following attachments. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed by the search committee. Please upload the following information with your application:
  • Letter of Interest/cover letter
  • Resume/Curriculum Vitae
Links:
To learn more about Riverland Community College, please visit https://www.riverland.edu

Minnesota State Colleges and Universities is an Equal Opportunity employer/educator committed to the principles of diversity. We prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their race, sex, color, creed, religion, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or membership in a local commission as defined by law. As an affirmative action employer, we actively seek and encourage applications from women, minorities, persons with disabilities, and individuals with protected veteran status.

job_body: Department: Admissions & New Student Enrol (8102)Location: Main CampusPosition Summary The Data Analyst reports to the Manager of Enrollment Analytics in Operations and Systems (OSM) unit in Enrollment Management. OSM houses the following units Undergraduate Admissions Processing Unit (Domestic/International), Enrollment Management and Systems Communication, and Student Affairs Systems Groups. OSM is responsible for the processing and review of undergraduate admissions for domestic and international students, the oversight of the Client Relationship Management system for prospective students, and desktop support, custom program development, web applications and data and reporting. The Data Analyst will analyze the data related to admissions and enrollment to create prediction models related to net tuition revenue and admissions yield. The Data Analyst will work with the Manager to analyze and interpret enrollment data. Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more! The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocations services, please click here. The University of Arizona is in the process of creating a new classification and compensation architecture. This University Career Architecture Project (UCAP) will revolutionize the way we think about professions and manage compensation at the UA. It is a two year initiative that will replace the current classified staff and appointed professional categories of employment with market-based job functions and families. As an applicant, UCAP will create clearer career paths and opportunities and will help you make more informed pay decisions. To learn more about this project, please visit ucap.arizona.edu. Duties & Responsibilities Analyzes and interprets quantitative and qualitative enrollment data. Conduct statistical modeling and analyses of institutional data in the support of strategic planning initiatives and decision-making Perform data analysis and develop effective models that identify trends and provide information to project net tuition revenue Collect and analyze student enrollment data to develop a better understanding of impacts to yield for student enrollment Conducts complex research and technical studies by collecting, analyzing, and compiling data related but not limited to such matters as enrollment, matriculation, budget and financial aid and institutional planning and effectiveness; prepares reports and recommendations on findings. Collaborate with UAIR (University Analytics and Institutional Research) on data collection and analysis Provide analysis results through reports, oral presentations and executive summaries using the knowledge of data analysis and analytics and enterprise information systems. Other duties as assigned Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Ability to work successfully in a team environment. Excellent time management and prioritization skills; ability to manage multiple projects and priorities and meet timelines. Knowledge of research design and methodologies and statistics Knowledge of higher education assessment and program review Knowledge of evaluation design Knowledge of Enrollment Management Skill in data collection, research, analysis, and development of recommendation and/or alternative solutions. Skill in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and interpretation. Skill in effective communication, both verbal and written. Experience with the principles, methods and techniques of developing queries for reporting and analysis. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or any relevant field that provides knowledge in quantitative and qualitative analysis Minimum of two years of related experience Demonstrated experience working with complex data in a relational database environment. Strong interest and aptitude in data analysis Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or any relevant field that provides knowledge in quantitative and qualitative analysis Demonstrated knowledge in statistical modeling and predictive analytics Minimum of five years of related experience in addition to the minimum qualifications Experience using front-end systems including UAccess Student (peoplesoft), and UAccess Learning Extensive and demonstrated knowledge of and experience with UAccess Analytics (OBIEE) Number of Hours Worked per Week: 40Job Category: Administrative and ProfessionalBenefits Eligible: Yes - Full BenefitsPosted Rate of Pay: $55,000 AnnuallyType of criminal background check required: Fingerprint criminal background check (security sensitive due to title or department)Posting Number: A24471Contact Information for Candidates Damien Snookemail: dsnook@email.arizona.edu Open Until Filled: YesReview Begins On: 01/21/2020Diversity Statement At the University of Arizona, we value our inclusive climate because we know that diversity in experiences and perspectives is vital to advancing innovation, critical thinking, solving complex problems, and creating an inclusive academic community. As an Hispanic-serving institution, we translate these values into action by seeking individuals who have experience and expertise working with diverse students, colleagues, and constituencies. Because we seek a workforce with a wide range of perspectives and experiences, we provide equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. As an Employer of National Service, we also welcome alumni of AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service programs and others who will help us advance our Inclusive Excellence initiative aimed at creating a university that values student, staff and faculty engagement in addressing issues of diversity and inclusiveness.
job_body_html:
Department: Admissions & New Student Enrol (8102)

Location: Main Campus

Position Summary

The Data Analyst reports to the Manager of Enrollment Analytics in Operations and Systems (OSM) unit in Enrollment Management. OSM houses the following units Undergraduate Admissions Processing Unit (Domestic/International), Enrollment Management and Systems Communication, and Student Affairs Systems Groups. OSM is responsible for the processing and review of undergraduate admissions for domestic and international students, the oversight of the Client Relationship Management system for prospective students, and desktop support, custom program development, web applications and data and reporting. The Data Analyst will analyze the data related to admissions and enrollment to create prediction models related to net tuition revenue and admissions yield.

The Data Analyst will work with the Manager to analyze and interpret enrollment data.

Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!

The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocations services, please click here.

The University of Arizona is in the process of creating a new classification and compensation architecture. This University Career Architecture Project (UCAP) will revolutionize the way we think about professions and manage compensation at the UA. It is a two year initiative that will replace the current classified staff and appointed professional categories of employment with market-based job functions and families. As an applicant, UCAP will create clearer career paths and opportunities and will help you make more informed pay decisions. To learn more about this project, please visit ucap.arizona.edu.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Analyzes and interprets quantitative and qualitative enrollment data.
  • Conduct statistical modeling and analyses of institutional data in the support of strategic planning initiatives and decision-making
  • Perform data analysis and develop effective models that identify trends and provide information to project net tuition revenue
  • Collect and analyze student enrollment data to develop a better understanding of impacts to yield for student enrollment
  • Conducts complex research and technical studies by collecting, analyzing, and compiling data related but not limited to such matters as enrollment, matriculation, budget and financial aid and institutional planning and effectiveness; prepares reports and recommendations on findings.
  • Collaborate with UAIR (University Analytics and Institutional Research) on data collection and analysis
  • Provide analysis results through reports, oral presentations and executive summaries using the knowledge of data analysis and analytics and enterprise information systems.
  • Other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
  • Ability to work successfully in a team environment.
  • Excellent time management and prioritization skills; ability to manage multiple projects and priorities and meet timelines.
  • Knowledge of research design and methodologies and statistics
  • Knowledge of higher education assessment and program review
  • Knowledge of evaluation design
  • Knowledge of Enrollment Management
  • Skill in data collection, research, analysis, and development of recommendation and/or alternative solutions.
  • Skill in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and interpretation.
  • Skill in effective communication, both verbal and written.
  • Experience with the principles, methods and techniques of developing queries for reporting and analysis.
Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or any relevant field that provides knowledge in quantitative and qualitative analysis
  • Minimum of two years of related experience
  • Demonstrated experience working with complex data in a relational database environment.
  • Strong interest and aptitude in data analysis
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or any relevant field that provides knowledge in quantitative and qualitative analysis
  • Demonstrated knowledge in statistical modeling and predictive analytics
  • Minimum of five years of related experience in addition to the minimum qualifications
  • Experience using front-end systems including UAccess Student (peoplesoft), and UAccess Learning
  • Extensive and demonstrated knowledge of and experience with UAccess Analytics (OBIEE)
Number of Hours Worked per Week: 40

Job Category: Administrative and Professional

Benefits Eligible: Yes - Full Benefits

Posted Rate of Pay: $55,000 Annually

Type of criminal background check required: Fingerprint criminal background check (security sensitive due to title or department)

Posting Number: A24471

Contact Information for Candidates

Damien Snook
email: dsnook@email.arizona.edu

Open Until Filled: Yes

Review Begins On: 01/21/2020

Diversity Statement

At the University of Arizona, we value our inclusive climate because we know that diversity in experiences and perspectives is vital to advancing innovation, critical thinking, solving complex problems, and creating an inclusive academic community. As an Hispanic-serving institution, we translate these values into action by seeking individuals who have experience and expertise working with diverse students, colleagues, and constituencies. Because we seek a workforce with a wide range of perspectives and experiences, we provide equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. As an Employer of National Service, we also welcome alumni of AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service programs and others who will help us advance our Inclusive Excellence initiative aimed at creating a university that values student, staff and faculty engagement in addressing issues of diversity and inclusiveness.

job_inst: University of North Carolina School of the Arts
job_body:
The School of the Arts opened its doors in 1965, and has since developed an international reputation for training talented artists from high
school through graduate school for careers in the performing, visual, and moving image arts. Students are admitted by competitive auditions
from throughout North Carolina, the United States and more than 20 foreign countries. UNCSA is divided into five separate Schools that
operate as arts conservatories (Dance, Design & Production, Drama, Filmmaking, and Music), in addition to two divisions (High School
Academics and the undergraduate Division of Liberal Arts). UNCSA is one of seventeen campuses of the University of North Carolina system,
and the first state-supported, residential school of its kind in the nation. Total enrollment for the 2019 fall semester was 1,339 high
school, undergraduate, and graduate students.The Office of Institutional Research (IR) monitors and manages the compilation and
dissemination of quantitative and qualitative information from internal and external sources to support institutional planning, management,
and evaluation and to comply with reporting requirements of State and Federal agencies and accrediting bodies, as well as information
requests from other approved external entities. The IR Office directs and validates all Federal IPEDS and UNC System DataMart reporting,
prepares SACSCOC accreditation profiles, the Common Data Set, and other submissions to external publications for prospective students. This
Office maintains IR webpages on the UNCSA website containing recent institutional performance data and conducts frequent periodic and ad hoc
data analysis and reporting in response to internal requests from UNCSA staff and faculty.The Assistant Director of
Institutional Research reports to the Senior Director of Institutional Research and Planning. The Assistant Director provides technical and
logistic end user training and support for various IR data collection and dissemination processes and platforms, including: the University
enterprise database (Ellucian Banner); third-party applications for conducting course evaluations, mid-term progress reports, multiple
internal surveys, and other IR activities; the UNC System data dashboard platform; UNCSA IR webpages; and submissions to approved external
publications.Specific Duties and Responsibilities of the PositionPrepare and upload data files to local
and third-party software application platforms for student course evaluations, mid-term progress reports, and student peer-to-peer
evaluations. Provide documentation, training, and support to students, staff and faculty using these applications (~25%);Work
closely with the Admissions, Financial Aid, and Registrar’s offices staff to ensure timely, accurate data entry into the University
enterprise resource planning (ERP) system (Ellucian Banner), error-free submission of these data to the UNC System DataMart, and the
distribution, analysis, and interpretation of ERP data to UNCSA staff and faculty (~20%);Compile, organize, and maintain data
portraying general institutional characteristics, including recent admissions, financial aid, net price, enrollment, and student progress
and completion data. Coordinate layout, formatting, and update schedule for posting of these data to IR webpages on the UNCSA website
(~20%);Administer access to the University survey software platform. Develop guidelines and provide training and technical
assistance to staff and faculty for development of surveys. Maintain and administer job candidate surveys for senior officers of the
University (~15%);Assist the Senior Director to prepare the Common Data Set and other submissions to external publications for
prospective students, including Peterson’s Guides, US News Best Colleges, and others (~10%);Grant access to UNC System
Insight Dashboards for UNCSA staff and faculty, and provide training and support for users of these dashboards (~5%);Other duties
as assigned by the Senior Director (~5%).Required Minimum Qualifications: Master’s degree in IR-related
discipline and 1-2 years IR experience, or IR-related Bachelor’s degree and 2-4 years IR experience.Preferred
Qualifications: IR-related Master’s degree and 3-5 years IR experience.Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and
AbilitiesProficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (particularly Excel and Word); demonstrated experience and proficiency
managing course evaluation software and survey software; attention to detail and ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks and
projects individually and working with others; experience with Ellucian Banner is highly desirable; familiarity with SQL programming or
Argos Report Writer is a plus.Hiring Salary Range: $49,600-$69,500 (based on qualifications and experience).Review of candidates will begin after February 3, 2020. For fullest consideration, please submit your application on or before this
date; however, applications will be accepted until this position is filled.Information and Online Application:
https://employment.uncsa.edu/postings/4621
job_body_html:
The School of the Arts opened its doors in 1965, and has since developed an international reputation for training talented artists from high school through graduate school for careers in the performing, visual, and moving image arts. Students are admitted by competitive auditions from throughout North Carolina, the United States and more than 20 foreign countries. UNCSA is divided into five separate Schools that operate as arts conservatories (Dance, Design & Production, Drama, Filmmaking, and Music), in addition to two divisions (High School Academics and the undergraduate Division of Liberal Arts). UNCSA is one of seventeen campuses of the University of North Carolina system, and the first state-supported, residential school of its kind in the nation. Total enrollment for the 2019 fall semester was 1,339 high school, undergraduate, and graduate students.

The Office of Institutional Research (IR) monitors and manages the compilation and dissemination of quantitative and qualitative information from internal and external sources to support institutional planning, management, and evaluation and to comply with reporting requirements of State and Federal agencies and accrediting bodies, as well as information requests from other approved external entities. The IR Office directs and validates all Federal IPEDS and UNC System DataMart reporting, prepares SACSCOC accreditation profiles, the Common Data Set, and other submissions to external publications for prospective students. This Office maintains IR webpages on the UNCSA website containing recent institutional performance data and conducts frequent periodic and ad hoc data analysis and reporting in response to internal requests from UNCSA staff and faculty.

The Assistant Director of Institutional Research reports to the Senior Director of Institutional Research and Planning. The Assistant Director provides technical and logistic end user training and support for various IR data collection and dissemination processes and platforms, including: the University enterprise database (Ellucian Banner); third-party applications for conducting course evaluations, mid-term progress reports, multiple internal surveys, and other IR activities; the UNC System data dashboard platform; UNCSA IR webpages; and submissions to approved external publications.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities of the Position
  • Prepare and upload data files to local and third-party software application platforms for student course evaluations, mid-term progress reports, and student peer-to-peer evaluations. Provide documentation, training, and support to students, staff and faculty using these applications (~25%);
  • Work closely with the Admissions, Financial Aid, and Registrar’s offices staff to ensure timely, accurate data entry into the University enterprise resource planning (ERP) system (Ellucian Banner), error-free submission of these data to the UNC System DataMart, and the distribution, analysis, and interpretation of ERP data to UNCSA staff and faculty (~20%);
  • Compile, organize, and maintain data portraying general institutional characteristics, including recent admissions, financial aid, net price, enrollment, and student progress and completion data. Coordinate layout, formatting, and update schedule for posting of these data to IR webpages on the UNCSA website (~20%);
  • Administer access to the University survey software platform. Develop guidelines and provide training and technical assistance to staff and faculty for development of surveys. Maintain and administer job candidate surveys for senior officers of the University (~15%);
  • Assist the Senior Director to prepare the Common Data Set and other submissions to external publications for prospective students, including Peterson’s Guides, US News Best Colleges, and others (~10%);
  • Grant access to UNC System Insight Dashboards for UNCSA staff and faculty, and provide training and support for users of these dashboards (~5%);
  • Other duties as assigned by the Senior Director (~5%).
Required Minimum Qualifications: Master’s degree in IR-related discipline and 1-2 years IR experience, or IR-related Bachelor’s degree and 2-4 years IR experience.

Preferred Qualifications: IR-related Master’s degree and 3-5 years IR experience.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (particularly Excel and Word); demonstrated experience and proficiency managing course evaluation software and survey software; attention to detail and ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks and projects individually and working with others; experience with Ellucian Banner is highly desirable; familiarity with SQL programming or Argos Report Writer is a plus.

Hiring Salary Range: $49,600-$69,500 (based on qualifications and experience).

Review of candidates will begin after February 3, 2020. For fullest consideration, please submit your application on or before this date; however, applications will be accepted until this position is filled.

Information and Online Application: https://employment.uncsa.edu/postings/4621

job_body: Posting Number: F003491 Position Status: Full Time Assignment Length: This field only applies to Faculty Grant Funded: No Category: APT Class Code: 14 Pay Rate: Commensurate with education and experience Location: Trinity River Department: DT Institutional Research Job Summary The Office of Institutional Research conducts ethical analysis that supports a culture of reflection and action by providing rich, timely, and accurate data in formats that are accessible and useful to decision-makers. Responsibilities of the Research Analyst include data: collection, analysis, interpretation and reporting. The job requires technical familiarity with data coding structures and conventions, knowledge of methodologies for quantitative and qualitative analysis, and a familiarity with the use of statistical software. Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Uses software packages (e.g. SPSS, Microsoft Excel, EMSI, etc.) for statistical and analytical purposes to produce descriptive statistics, longitudinal/predictive analyses, and other derivable reports/models specific to analytical software.   Collaborates with institutional research staff to provide timely, relevant and accurate institutional information to internal and external audiences.   Assists in summarizing and producing reports, models, and summaries of data on relevant job market conditions, industry trends, and demographic/workforce information.   Works with large complex data sets, including exporting/importing and merging from various sources, cleaning data files and maintaining historical records.   Prepares reports, summarizing data and analyses that present results in a clear and concise manner for multiple audiences, including the creation of clear and effective charts and tables.   Supports institutional research staff by proofreading reports, correspondence, and statistical tables for accuracy and completeness, as well as helping to reconcile discrepancies and investigate data anomalies.   Maintains security of confidential student and employee information.   Assists institutional research staff with departmental outreach by supporting them on collaborative projects, including the design and analysis of quantitative and qualitative research projects.   Attends the workplace regularly, reports to work punctually and follows a work schedule to keep up with the demands of the worksite   Completes all required training and professional development sessions sponsored through Tarrant County College (TCC)   Supports the values of the College: diversity, teaching excellence, student success, innovation and creativity, and service to the College   Supports the mission, values and 3 goals and 8 principles of the College   Performs other duties as assigned. The duties listed are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position. The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. Required Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensures  Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in math/statistics, computer science, social/behavioral sciences, higher education administration or a related field   Two (2) years of work experience in a related area   Ability to interact and effectively communicate findings to a diverse constituency   Ability to be adaptable and have great attention to detail while working on multiple projects with competing deadlines   Have a systematic and logic-based approach to problem solving   Demonstrate the ability to interpret, find patterns, and derive meaning from the analysis of data   Detail-oriented, organized and resourceful with the ability to complete projects with rapidly changing priorities   Excellent oral and written communication skills   Willingness to make a professional commitment through continuing education and participation in professional conferences and workshops   Experience with computerized systems   Proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software (e.g. Microsoft Office)   Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills Desired Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensures  Master's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in math/statistics, computer science, social/behavioral sciences, higher education administration or a related field   Experience in accessing data from multiple sources and merging them to perform analyses   Familiarity with labor market software such as EMSI, Burning Glass, or other similar packages   Familiarity with external reporting, including data collections for Peterson's, National Student Clearinghouse and IPEDS   Knowledge of CCSSE and SENSE   Knowledge of CBM State Reporting Accommodations Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities. Contact: Kira Barringtonkira.barrington@tccd.edu
job_body_html:
Posting Number: F003491

Position Status: Full Time

Assignment Length: This field only applies to Faculty

Grant Funded: No

Category: APT

Class Code: 14

Pay Rate: Commensurate with education and experience

Location: Trinity River

Department: DT Institutional Research

Job Summary

The Office of Institutional Research conducts ethical analysis that supports a culture of reflection and action by providing rich, timely, and accurate data in formats that are accessible and useful to decision-makers. Responsibilities of the Research Analyst include data: collection, analysis, interpretation and reporting. The job requires technical familiarity with data coding structures and conventions, knowledge of methodologies for quantitative and qualitative analysis, and a familiarity with the use of statistical software.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Uses software packages (e.g. SPSS, Microsoft Excel, EMSI, etc.) for statistical and analytical purposes to produce descriptive statistics, longitudinal/predictive analyses, and other derivable reports/models specific to analytical software.
  • Collaborates with institutional research staff to provide timely, relevant and accurate institutional information to internal and external audiences.
  • Assists in summarizing and producing reports, models, and summaries of data on relevant job market conditions, industry trends, and demographic/workforce information.
  • Works with large complex data sets, including exporting/importing and merging from various sources, cleaning data files and maintaining historical records.
  • Prepares reports, summarizing data and analyses that present results in a clear and concise manner for multiple audiences, including the creation of clear and effective charts and tables.
  • Supports institutional research staff by proofreading reports, correspondence, and statistical tables for accuracy and completeness, as well as helping to reconcile discrepancies and investigate data anomalies.
  • Maintains security of confidential student and employee information.
  • Assists institutional research staff with departmental outreach by supporting them on collaborative projects, including the design and analysis of quantitative and qualitative research projects.
  • Attends the workplace regularly, reports to work punctually and follows a work schedule to keep up with the demands of the worksite
  • Completes all required training and professional development sessions sponsored through Tarrant County College (TCC)
  • Supports the values of the College: diversity, teaching excellence, student success, innovation and creativity, and service to the College
  • Supports the mission, values and 3 goals and 8 principles of the College
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

The duties listed are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position. The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.

Required Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensures

  • Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in math/statistics, computer science, social/behavioral sciences, higher education administration or a related field
  • Two (2) years of work experience in a related area
  • Ability to interact and effectively communicate findings to a diverse constituency
  • Ability to be adaptable and have great attention to detail while working on multiple projects with competing deadlines
  • Have a systematic and logic-based approach to problem solving
  • Demonstrate the ability to interpret, find patterns, and derive meaning from the analysis of data
  • Detail-oriented, organized and resourceful with the ability to complete projects with rapidly changing priorities
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Willingness to make a professional commitment through continuing education and participation in professional conferences and workshops
  • Experience with computerized systems
  • Proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software (e.g. Microsoft Office)
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills

Desired Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensures

  • Master's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in math/statistics, computer science, social/behavioral sciences, higher education administration or a related field
  • Experience in accessing data from multiple sources and merging them to perform analyses
  • Familiarity with labor market software such as EMSI, Burning Glass, or other similar packages
  • Familiarity with external reporting, including data collections for Peterson's, National Student Clearinghouse and IPEDS
  • Knowledge of CCSSE and SENSE
  • Knowledge of CBM State Reporting

Accommodations

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities.

Contact: Kira Barrington

kira.barrington@tccd.edu

job_body: Position Availability: ASAP Requisition Number: 0206073107Location: New York CityPosition Type: AdministrativePosition Status: Full-TimeDepartment: CA/Development/AdvancementServicesResponsibilities The role of the Data Analyst is to provide support to The New School's Office of Development and Alumni Relations team and other areas of the University by analyzing and interpreting demographic and financial data. The Data Analyst will work with both technical and non-technical staff to design, code, implement, and support reporting (scheduled and ad-hoc) using SQL/Tableau. The ideal candidate will have strong data analysis experience with relational databases (preferably Ellucian's Banner Advancement) and will lead the production of new reports and robust analytic approaches to advance University fundraising efforts. The successful candidate will be a service-oriented leader with the strong communication skills, an eye for details, and a passion for data and problem-solving. The Data Analyst reports to the Team Lead, Reporting and Analysis within the Advancement Services team. Responsibilities: Creates reports and data extracts for development, alumni relations, and other departments throughout the University. Assists with the implementation of the data warehouse and Tableau in collaboration with the Report and Analysis and the IT Business Intelligence teams. Develop and prepare highly segmented reports and mailing lists, according to a high-volume, time-sensitive production calendar. Analyzes and interprets the data to identify issues and recommend appropriate methods to resolve data integrity concerns. May participate in data clean-up projects as necessary. Works with the Advancement Services team to identify system and process improvements and perform data integrity analysis. Proactively communicates and collaborates to analyze information needs and requirements to deliver a project that meets stakeholder satisfaction. Creates and maintains technical and end user documentation as it relates to reporting and analytics. Assists in the training of UDARO colleagues as it relates to reporting and the use of the reporting tools. Assists with the completion of external surveys (such as VSE and US News and World Report) and benchmarking projects. Assists department analytics projects. Other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree. Must have basic understanding of relational databases; Banner Advancement experience preferred. Minimum of 1 years experience writing standard queries and reports; Tableau experience preferred. Proficient competency with SQL, PL/SQL and SQL Server/Oracle databases. Strong communication skills; Must be able to write, communicate, facilitate, and present clearly to all levels within the University; ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical terms. Ability to gather requirements, design, develop, maintain, and distribute complex reports for non-technical audiences. Excellent analysis and problem solving competence, data science or data analytics background preferred . Ability to work independently and collaboratively. Ability to manage and to complete detailed assignments within specified timeframe, and adapt to changing situations and priorities. Must be comfortable in an environment that places high emphasis on continuous improvement, teamwork, and excellent customer service. Knowledge and understanding of fundraising in a higher education or large non-profit organization. Strong Proficiency in MS Office Suite specifically MS Excel. Highly organized and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously while having the ability to shift work seamlessly when priorities change. Job Family: DevelopmentPosting Date: 01/10/2020Open Until Filled: Yes

Position Availability:

ASAP

Requisition Number: 0206073107

Location: New York City

Position Type: Administrative

Position Status: Full-Time

Department: CA/Development/AdvancementServices

Responsibilities

The role of the Data Analyst is to provide support to The New School's Office of Development and Alumni Relations team and other areas of the University by analyzing and interpreting demographic and financial data. The Data Analyst will work with both technical and non-technical staff to design, code, implement, and support reporting (scheduled and ad-hoc) using SQL/Tableau. The ideal candidate will have strong data analysis experience with relational databases (preferably Ellucian's Banner Advancement) and will lead the production of new reports and robust analytic approaches to advance University fundraising efforts. The successful candidate will be a service-oriented leader with the strong communication skills, an eye for details, and a passion for data and problem-solving. The Data Analyst reports to the Team Lead, Reporting and Analysis within the Advancement Services team.

Responsibilities:

  • Creates reports and data extracts for development, alumni relations, and other departments throughout the University.
  • Assists with the implementation of the data warehouse and Tableau in collaboration with the Report and Analysis and the IT Business Intelligence teams.
  • Develop and prepare highly segmented reports and mailing lists, according to a high-volume, time-sensitive production calendar.
  • Analyzes and interprets the data to identify issues and recommend appropriate methods to resolve data integrity concerns. May participate in data clean-up projects as necessary.
  • Works with the Advancement Services team to identify system and process improvements and perform data integrity analysis.
  • Proactively communicates and collaborates to analyze information needs and requirements to deliver a project that meets stakeholder satisfaction.
  • Creates and maintains technical and end user documentation as it relates to reporting and analytics. Assists in the training of UDARO colleagues as it relates to reporting and the use of the reporting tools.
  • Assists with the completion of external surveys (such as VSE and US News and World Report) and benchmarking projects.
  • Assists department analytics projects.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree.
  • Must have basic understanding of relational databases; Banner Advancement experience preferred.
  • Minimum of 1 years experience writing standard queries and reports; Tableau experience preferred. Proficient competency with SQL, PL/SQL and SQL Server/Oracle databases.
  • Strong communication skills; Must be able to write, communicate, facilitate, and present clearly to all levels within the University; ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical terms.
  • Ability to gather requirements, design, develop, maintain, and distribute complex reports for non-technical audiences.
  • Excellent analysis and problem solving competence, data science or data analytics background preferred .
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
  • Ability to manage and to complete detailed assignments within specified timeframe, and adapt to changing situations and priorities.
  • Must be comfortable in an environment that places high emphasis on continuous improvement, teamwork, and excellent customer service.
  • Knowledge and understanding of fundraising in a higher education or large non-profit organization.
  • Strong Proficiency in MS Office Suite specifically MS Excel.
  • Highly organized and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously while having the ability to shift work seamlessly when priorities change.
Job Family: Development

Posting Date: 01/10/2020

Open Until Filled: Yes

job_name: Director of Assessment, Institutional Research and Reporting
job_inst: Southern California University of Health Sciences
job_body:
The Director of Assessment, Institutional Research and Reporting oversees assessment, institutional research and reporting functions that
support SCU’s strategic vision and decision-making processes. In collaboration with the Office of Institutional Effectiveness,
academic programs and administrative units, the Director of Assessment, Institutional Research and Reporting contributes to institutional
effectiveness initiatives, as they relate to SCU’s ongoing, systematic evaluation and improvement of its functioning.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties
may be assigned.Assessment FunctionsLeads the implementation of assessment activities of academic programs,
administrative units, university learning outcomes as well as other assessment studies, in alignment with SCU’s Institutional
Effectiveness activities.Analyzes the University’s assessment data and effectively use results to inform and improve academic
quality and operational efficiency.Organizes, manages and maintains assessment evidence at the institutional level, as well as
documentation of the use of the results.Consults with academic programs and administrative units on goals and student learning
outcomes assessment, methodology, data analysis, and interpretation of results for their planning and actions for continuous
improvement.Prepares and maintains assessment data reports and documentation for accrediting bodies, including data for WASC Senior
College and University Commission (WSCUC), Council for Chiropractic Education, (CCE), Accreditation Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental
Medicine (ACAOM), The Academic Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant (ARC-PA), and other accreditation agencies
supporting existing or future programs.Supports, coordinates, creates, and delivers training programs for administrators, faculty
and staff on the use of ExamSoft, Examplify and other assessment tools for campus wide assessment initiatives.Collaborates with
both academic and administrative areas to offer professional development workshops, training, and resources on the topics of assessment,
continuous improvement, analysis and reporting.Institutional Research and Reporting FunctionsProvides oversight and
supervision for institutional research and reporting functions for environmental scanning and accreditation processes.Performs
extensive querying of data from the institution's Student Information System (SIS) and other databases using SQL and other
tools.Oversee the administration of the university-wide Student Rating of Instructors (SRI) process.Ensuring that reports
provide meaningful, appropriate and accurate data and supporting documentation is available to meet the decision-making needs of the
University;Compiles, analyzes and disseminates quantitative data on facets of the University and related educational issues,
including areas such as institutional characteristics, enrollments, student retention, student transfer activities, enrollment projections,
grades, and other student performance indicators and fiscal affairs.Coordinates, compiles and submits annual IPEDS reports and
other external facing reports as required.Assist the Dean of Institutional Effectiveness the collection of data and development of
reports related to educational and institutional effectiveness.Performs additional tasks as
assigned.COMPETENCIES:To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following
competencies:High level of proficiency in current assessment methodologies in health care related education, with particular
emphasis on clinical skills, communication, critical reasoning, and problem solving.A working knowledge of Jenzebar or other SIS,
SQL, and/or SPSS/R/SAS, as well as a strong interest in institutional research and academic analyses is preferred.Working knowledge
of business intelligence tools; experience/knowledge of data dictionaries, institutional Fact books, dashboards; superior organizational,
analytical and problem-solving skills; and excellent communication skills.Strong skills and commitment to the use of medical
education related assessment software e.g. ExamSoft, Exam Master, Akindi, etc.Ability to support faculty and staff in the
development of consistent and progressive methods of outcomes assessment.Ability to operate and customize standard office equipment
and software to produce a wide variety of customized reportsStrong written and oral communication skills and strong organizational
skills.Display a high degree of discretion regarding institutional data and related informationAbility to work
independently and be a resourceful problem solver in order to complete assignments and projects as per defined timelines.Knowledge
of data query and reporting;EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Master's degree (M.A.) or equivalent in educational
research, higher education administration, educational psychology, social science, statistics, or related discipline.Three to
five years’ experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and progressively responsible experience in
institutional research/assessment/reporting in higher education.
job_body_html:
The Director of Assessment, Institutional Research and Reporting oversees assessment, institutional research and reporting functions that support SCU’s strategic vision and decision-making processes. In collaboration with the Office of Institutional Effectiveness, academic programs and administrative units, the Director of Assessment, Institutional Research and Reporting contributes to institutional effectiveness initiatives, as they relate to SCU’s ongoing, systematic evaluation and improvement of its functioning.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Assessment Functions
  • Leads the implementation of assessment activities of academic programs, administrative units, university learning outcomes as well as other assessment studies, in alignment with SCU’s Institutional Effectiveness activities.
  • Analyzes the University’s assessment data and effectively use results to inform and improve academic quality and operational efficiency.
  • Organizes, manages and maintains assessment evidence at the institutional level, as well as documentation of the use of the results.
  • Consults with academic programs and administrative units on goals and student learning outcomes assessment, methodology, data analysis, and interpretation of results for their planning and actions for continuous improvement.
  • Prepares and maintains assessment data reports and documentation for accrediting bodies, including data for WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC), Council for Chiropractic Education, (CCE), Accreditation Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (ACAOM), The Academic Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant (ARC-PA), and other accreditation agencies supporting existing or future programs.
  • Supports, coordinates, creates, and delivers training programs for administrators, faculty and staff on the use of ExamSoft, Examplify and other assessment tools for campus wide assessment initiatives.
  • Collaborates with both academic and administrative areas to offer professional development workshops, training, and resources on the topics of assessment, continuous improvement, analysis and reporting.
Institutional Research and Reporting Functions
  • Provides oversight and supervision for institutional research and reporting functions for environmental scanning and accreditation processes.
  • Performs extensive querying of data from the institution's Student Information System (SIS) and other databases using SQL and other tools.
  • Oversee the administration of the university-wide Student Rating of Instructors (SRI) process.
  • Ensuring that reports provide meaningful, appropriate and accurate data and supporting documentation is available to meet the decision-making needs of the University;
  • Compiles, analyzes and disseminates quantitative data on facets of the University and related educational issues, including areas such as institutional characteristics, enrollments, student retention, student transfer activities, enrollment projections, grades, and other student performance indicators and fiscal affairs.
  • Coordinates, compiles and submits annual IPEDS reports and other external facing reports as required.
  • Assist the Dean of Institutional Effectiveness the collection of data and development of reports related to educational and institutional effectiveness.
  • Performs additional tasks as assigned.
COMPETENCIES:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
  • High level of proficiency in current assessment methodologies in health care related education, with particular emphasis on clinical skills, communication, critical reasoning, and problem solving.
  • A working knowledge of Jenzebar or other SIS, SQL, and/or SPSS/R/SAS, as well as a strong interest in institutional research and academic analyses is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of business intelligence tools; experience/knowledge of data dictionaries, institutional Fact books, dashboards; superior organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills; and excellent communication skills.
  • Strong skills and commitment to the use of medical education related assessment software e.g. ExamSoft, Exam Master, Akindi, etc.
  • Ability to support faculty and staff in the development of consistent and progressive methods of outcomes assessment.
  • Ability to operate and customize standard office equipment and software to produce a wide variety of customized reports
  • Strong written and oral communication skills and strong organizational skills.
  • Display a high degree of discretion regarding institutional data and related information
  • Ability to work independently and be a resourceful problem solver in order to complete assignments and projects as per defined timelines.
  • Knowledge of data query and reporting;
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Master's degree (M.A.) or equivalent in educational research, higher education administration, educational psychology, social science, statistics, or related discipline.

Three to five years’ experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and progressively responsible experience in institutional research/assessment/reporting in higher education.

Ecampus is seeking an Ecampus Research Unit Director. This is a full-time (1.0 FTE),12-month, fixed term professional faculty position.
Reappointment is at the discretion of the Executive Director.Oregon State Ecampus is a growing, innovative and collaborative
organization with a commitment to providing high-quality online degrees and programs. Ecampus makes OSU’s exceptional learning
experiences available to students throughout Oregon and around the world.The Ecampus Research Director provides leadership and
administrative management to the Ecampus Research Unit, which conducts original research in online teaching and learning (including the
subset of hybrid instruction), supports OSU faculty in conducting research in online teaching and learning, and convenes and
participates national discussions related to online education, including research discussion groups, multi-year seminar programs, and other
national programs and activities.The director of this unit also leads the development of research-related tools and promotes
research literacy within Ecampus and broadly in the field of online education. The unit’s director establishes, implements, and
facilitates assessment of the research unit’s goals and policies and leads a team including other researchers and administrative
support personnel. This director serves along with other Ecampus unit directors as a member of the Ecampus leadership team.The
position will be responsible for directing a research fellows program; directing the use of budgeted funds for unit operations and to
maintain the award program; initiating, developing and maintaining multiple entrepreneurial activities including proposals to external
granting agencies. This director also serves as the principal liaison with external state, national and industrial partners to identify and
facilitate opportunities in developing partnerships and cooperative research projects.Oregon State University
and OSU Ecampus maintain and enhance a collaborative and inclusive community that is dedicated to equity and equal opportunity.
All employees of this division are responsible for ensuring that these commitments are achieved. This position directly contributes to these
goals by overseeing the design of research projects and tools that prioritize inclusivity and accessibility for a range of stakeholders.Minimum qualifications:Master’s degree from an accredited institution5 years of demonstrated
experience with research projects, to include idea conception, design, implementation and review/assessment for project
developmentDemonstrated leadership skills or supervisory experienceExcellent written, oral, and interpersonal
communication skillsA demonstrable commitment to promoting and enhancing diversity, including the ability to collaborate
effectively across diverse cultures, units and organizationsStrong analytical skills, including fluency with both qualitative and
quantitative methodologies.Demonstrable understanding of university environments, specifically in regard to human subject research
protocolsDemonstrable experience with implementation of full-cycle assessment and/or program level accountabilityThis
position is designated as a critical or security-sensitive position; therefore, the incumbent must successfully complete a Criminal History
Check and be determined to be position qualified as per OSU STANDARD 576-055-0000 et seq. Incumbents are required to
self-report convictions and those in Youth Programs may have additional Criminal History Checks every 24 months. Offers of employment are
contingent upon meeting all minimum qualifications including the Criminal History Check Requirement.Preferred
Qualifications Ph.D. within one year of start dateExperience disseminating research, such as in white papers,
peer-reviewed journals, book chapters, webinars, and/or professional conference presentationsDemonstrated success leading, or
playing an instrumental role in, successful grant proposalsDemonstrable understanding of pedagogical approaches in higher
education, specifically in the online and technology enabled environmentExperience managing project, program or department budgets
and/or resourcesAdministrative experience in higher educationFor more information and to apply go to http://jobs.oregonstate.edu/postings/87246Application deadline: 1/26/2020When applying you will be required to attach the following electronic
documents:1) A Curriculum vitae; and2) A cover letter indicating how your qualifications and experience have prepared
you for this position.You will also be required to submit the names of at least three professional references, their e-mail
addresses and telephone numbers as part of the application process.
job_body_html:
Ecampus is seeking an Ecampus Research Unit Director. This is a full-time (1.0 FTE),12-month, fixed term professional faculty position. Reappointment is at the discretion of the Executive Director.

Oregon State Ecampus is a growing, innovative and collaborative organization with a commitment to providing high-quality online degrees and programs. Ecampus makes OSU’s exceptional learning experiences available to students throughout Oregon and around the world.

The Ecampus Research Director provides leadership and administrative management to the Ecampus Research Unit, which conducts original research in online teaching and learning (including the subset of hybrid instruction), supports OSU faculty in conducting research in online teaching and learning, and convenes and participates national discussions related to online education, including research discussion groups, multi-year seminar programs, and other national programs and activities.

The director of this unit also leads the development of research-related tools and promotes research literacy within Ecampus and broadly in the field of online education. The unit’s director establishes, implements, and facilitates assessment of the research unit’s goals and policies and leads a team including other researchers and administrative support personnel. This director serves along with other Ecampus unit directors as a member of the Ecampus leadership team.

The position will be responsible for directing a research fellows program; directing the use of budgeted funds for unit operations and to maintain the award program; initiating, developing and maintaining multiple entrepreneurial activities including proposals to external granting agencies. This director also serves as the principal liaison with external state, national and industrial partners to identify and facilitate opportunities in developing partnerships and cooperative research projects.

Oregon State University and OSU Ecampus maintain and enhance a collaborative and inclusive community that is dedicated to equity and equal opportunity. All employees of this division are responsible for ensuring that these commitments are achieved. This position directly contributes to these goals by overseeing the design of research projects and tools that prioritize inclusivity and accessibility for a range of stakeholders.

Minimum qualifications:
  • Master’s degree from an accredited institution
  • 5 years of demonstrated experience with research projects, to include idea conception, design, implementation and review/assessment for project development
  • Demonstrated leadership skills or supervisory experience
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • A demonstrable commitment to promoting and enhancing diversity, including the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse cultures, units and organizations
  • Strong analytical skills, including fluency with both qualitative and quantitative methodologies.
  • Demonstrable understanding of university environments, specifically in regard to human subject research protocols
  • Demonstrable experience with implementation of full-cycle assessment and/or program level accountability
  • This position is designated as a critical or security-sensitive position; therefore, the incumbent must successfully complete a Criminal History Check and be determined to be position qualified as per OSU STANDARD 576-055-0000 et seq. Incumbents are required to self-report convictions and those in Youth Programs may have additional Criminal History Checks every 24 months. Offers of employment are contingent upon meeting all minimum qualifications including the Criminal History Check Requirement.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Ph.D. within one year of start date
  • Experience disseminating research, such as in white papers, peer-reviewed journals, book chapters, webinars, and/or professional conference presentations
  • Demonstrated success leading, or playing an instrumental role in, successful grant proposals
  • Demonstrable understanding of pedagogical approaches in higher education, specifically in the online and technology enabled environment
  • Experience managing project, program or department budgets and/or resources
  • Administrative experience in higher education
For more information and to apply go to http://jobs.oregonstate.edu/postings/87246

Application deadline: 1/26/2020

When applying you will be required to attach the following electronic documents:
1) A Curriculum vitae; and
2) A cover letter indicating how your qualifications and experience have prepared you for this position.

You will also be required to submit the names of at least three professional references, their e-mail addresses and telephone numbers as part of the application process.
